gurmukhi: ਗਿਰੇ ਹੀਰ ਚੀਰੰ ਸੁ ਬੀਰੰ ਰਜਾਨੰ ||
transliteration: Gire Heer Chderan Su Bderan Rajaanan||
translation: The warriors experienced bloodbath and fell with their clothes filled with blood.

gurmukhi: ਕਟੇ ਅੱਧ ਅੱਧੰ ਛੁਟੇ ਰੁਦ੍ਰ ਧਯਾਨੰ ||੧੪||੧੮੨||
transliteration: Kate Addh Addhan Chhoute Rudra Dhayaanan||14||182||
translation: They were chopped into halves; the contemplation of Shva was interrupted.14.182.
Many Kshatriyas of reputation fell in the battlefield.
The dreadful sound of kettledrums and trumpets resounded.

gurmukhi: ਕਰੇ ਪੈਜ ਵਾਰੰ ਪ੍ਰਚਾਰੈ ਸੁ ਬੀਰੰ ||
transliteration: Dare Paij Vaaran Prachdarai Su Bderan||
translation: The heroic warriors were shouting and making pledges, and also striking blows.

transliteration: Phire Round Mounndan Tanan Tachchh Tiran||15||183||
translation: The trunks and heads, and bodies pierced by arrows were roaming.15.183.
The shafts were penetrating into the steel-armour;
And the heroic warriors were destroying the pride of others.

gurmukhi: ਕਟੇ ਚਰਮ ਬਰਮੰ ਛੁਟੇ ਚੳੁਰ ਚਾਰੰ ||
transliteration: Kate Charam Barman Chhoute Chaur Chaaran||
translation: The bodies and armour were being cut and the flywhicks were being trampled;

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰੇ ਬੀਰ ਧੀਰੰ ਛੁਟੇ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਧਾਰੰ ||੧੬||੧੮੪||
transliteration: Gire Beer Dhderan Chhoute Sastra Dhaaran||16||184||
translation: And with the blows of weapons, the bold warriors were falling.16.184.
The king of Kashi was conquered and all his forces were destroyed.
Both his daughters were wedded by Janmeja, seeing which Shiva, the three-eyed god, trembled.

gurmukhi: ਭੲਿਓ ਮੇਲ ਗੇਲੰ ਮਿਲੇ ਰਾਜ ਰਾਜੰ ||
transliteration: Bhaio Mel Gelan Mile Raaj Raajan||
translation: Both the kings then became friendly; the conquered kingdom was returned,

gurmukhi: ਭੲੀ ਮਿਤ੍ਰ ਚਾਰੰ ਸਰੇ ਸਰਬ ਕਾਜੰ ||੧੭||੧੮੫||
translation: Friendship developed between both the kings and all their works were settled appropriately.17.185.
